item.title: Campaigning is hard work...
item.author: Abigail E de Bruin,Benjamin Howitt,Tom Rivlin,
item.description: Tom Rivlin: Deputy President (Clubs and Societies) candidate, 2015 Let’s get one thing out of the way first: yes, I did just lose in the Big Elections. Yes, I am extremely bitter about this. Yes, you can read the whole article as just a sore loser whining about losing sorely if you want. That said I …

item.title: How Adventure Time saved Cartoon Network
item.author: Tom Rivlin,
item.description: It’s safe to say that Adventure Time (AT), the hit eleven-minute cartoon about Jake the dog, Finn the human, and their crazy adventures, has been a huge success for its studio/host channel, Cartoon Network (CN). Now in its sixth season, the show has amassed a huge audience of children providing …

item.title: How Reddit made it okay to hate women
item.author: Tom Rivlin,
item.description: Last week I wrote in Felix about ‘GamerGate’, a loosely defined movement nominally about “ethics in video game journalism”. In the article I outlined how really the movement is about harassing women online. But GamerGate wasn’t created when some developer was accused of sleeping around: it’s the …

item.title: GamerGate: not about ethics in journalism
item.author: Tom Rivlin,
item.description: Anyone with an interest in feminism, social media, video games or nerd culture in general has probably heard this term over the past few months: GamerGate. What exactly is it? Why is it so awful? To get to the bottom of this we need to take a long, ugly look at gaming culture… The short version of …

item.title: Cartoon Corner – Teen Titans Go!
item.author: Tom Rivlin,
item.description: Fandoms can be weird places sometimes. Let me explain… _Teen Titans _was a superhero cartoon (‘capeshit’, as my flatmates call it) that ran for five seasons from 2003, based on the long-running DC comic book of the same name. It was fairly popular, with above average writing and characters …

item.title: Where the hell did this come from?
item.author: Tom Rivlin,
item.description: Dan Harmon’s beloved sitcom _Community _has long been known to fans as a ‘genre’ show smuggled onto our screens under the disguise of a regular comedy about a community college. In Adult Swim cartoon Rick and Morty, co-creator Dan Harmon has done the opposite – he’s managed to smuggle an earnest, …

item.title: Twitch Plays Pokémon: Alive and Kicking
item.author: Tom Rivlin,
item.description: Remember that thing that everyone cared about for one week in February? To a future historian it’ll look like a weird mind virus infected everyone for exactly a week and then disappeared. Let’s talk about it again! If you missed it, in February a programmer created a channel on Twitch (a game …

item.title: Singularity Sky
item.author: Tom Rivlin,
item.description: It’s hard to decide whether Singularity Sky is hard or soft sci-fi. Inherent to the setting of the book is faster-than-light (FTL) travel and an omnipotent, post-singularity AI. However that stuff is all really just a backdrop to incredibly nerdy (and delightful) discussions of …

item.title: Cartoon Corner: Adventure Time
item.author: Tom Rivlin,
item.description: Welcome to Cartoon Corner, the new weekly column where we explore the wonderful world of animation! (Not anime. We have a separate club for that.) Each week I’ll be doing either a review of a currently airing show, or a retrospective on something more nostalgic. So, word counts are tight here, let’s …
